alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 10:28PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Clark and Taylor Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jump River to Elk Mound. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jump River around 1035 PM CDT. Westboro around 1100 PM CDT. Rib Lake around 1110 PM CDT. Thorp around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Polley, The Mondeaux Flowage, Atwood, Perkinstown, Highway M And Joe Martin Road, Esadore Lake, Eidsvold, Longwood, Donald and Curtiss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
